38754858.review:
Очень рекомендую. 

Много уровней, большая часть проходится довольно быстро, но над некоторыми надо поломать голову. 
80 уровней Истории можно проходить как одному, так и с другом, но только локально, к сожалению.
Много забавных диалогов между Дэвидом - раздолбом-оператором ботов - и Айрис - ИИ, которая всячески подкалывает Дэвида. В их разговорах тут и там проскакивают отсылочки, киноманы будут в восторге.

Напоследок: если взяли игру, но уровень не даётся - милости прошу, загляните в моё руководство: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1244721459]КЛИК[/url]

38547302.review:
[b]Death Squared[/b] is a clever co-op puzzle game where the objective is simply to place all the coloured blocks on their respective goals. Although the premise is simple, each puzzle requires careful coordination between all the players involved. One false move, and you’re out! Be prepared to laugh, face-palm, scream, and/or cry. 
[b]NOTE:[/b] I haven’t had the opportunity to try the 4 player mode yet, so this review refers mainly to the 2 player mode.

[h1][u]Positive:[/u][/h1]
[list]
[*]This game is designed in such a way that anyone can start playing at any point. The controls are as basic as they get (essentially D-pad movement) and there are only a few concepts to learn. 
[*]Level/puzzle design is brilliant. They are designed with every player in mind – every member of the team must cooperate to beat a level. The puzzles also feel very fair. You have all the information you need to beat any given level, it just requires careful thought and a little trial and error.
[*]I enjoyed the look of the characters. At a first glance, it is obvious that they have different colours and number of lenses (1-4). However, if you look carefully, you can see that they all have a unique design; little bits and pieces that are specific to each block. It’s also nice that you can wear hats to further personalize your blocks. 
[/list]

[h1][u]Negative:[/u][/h1]
[list]
[*]Only local co-op in a co-op-centric game. This is probably a major downside for many players because you lose the ability to play with anyone outside your immediate vicinity. You could also play alone, but that defeats the purpose of this game. 
[*]I was quite surprised that there is no key remapping option. This is especially difficult for people who use a keyboard and want to play with 4 players. Just so you have an idea: player 1 (arrow keys), player 2 (wasd), player 3 (left shift + arrow keys), player 4 (right shift + wasd). Basically, not feasible. 
[*]In my experience, the multidirectional box can be difficult to push as it often latches on to corners. While not terribly annoying, it would be nice if this could be improved somehow. There are also some cases where your bot can be flung across the screen – although this is more entertaining than it is frustrating.
[*]You are navigating on a 3D environment but the camera is fixed. As such, it can be difficult to judge depth, height, and position accurately. There were several instances where I had to focus intensely to figure out the layout of the map. It would be nice if the camera was semi adjustable (only movable within a small range and automatically bounces back to the default position) to address this issue. 
[/list]

[h1][u]Conslusion:[/u][/h1]
[h1]★★★✬☆ Great for CO-OP [/h1]

I played Death Squared with my SO. Despite not being proficient at games, she really enjoyed playing it. There is a brilliant balance between the playability and difficulty in this game. The controls and rules are simple enough that anyone can pick them up, while the challenge comes from clever level design and partner coordination. The puzzles never felt unfair, but often made us scratch our heads. 
I suspect that Death Squared is not as popular as it could be due to the local co-op limitation. Regardless, I find that video games are usually best enjoyed as a local co-op experience, since the emotions shared become exponentially more vivid. Like [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/ready2b/recommended/448510/]Overcooked[/url] and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/ready2b/recommended/323850/]Move or Die[/url], I find that Death Squared is a fantastic example of a game best experienced locally. If you enjoy co-op puzzle games, this game is a must.

[table]
[tr]
[th]If you enjoyed this review please follow me on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26827738-%27b-Reviews/?appid=241930]curator page[/url] and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/breviews]group[/url]. Your time and support is greatly appreciated![/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/gaming_until_end ]Gaming Until End[/url], through the generous contribution of [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/HellCowON]HellCow.[/url] [/quote]

Have you been wanting to play so bad w/ friends when they come to your place?
This game is the answer for you!
This local multiplayer puzzle is so great that by the end of playing,
you and/or others will be upset at each other and will not want to talk to each 
other "in a while"(...couple of days, maybe a week). Who knows?

38133882.review:
This game is very challenging and has interesting mechanics. I haven't completed either mode yet, but plan to.

Note that it is not two to four players but rather 2 or 4 players, and the 2 player and 4 player modes have different puzzles. We're almost through with the 4 player mode and it's been challenging to try to coordinate 4 people and we have died many times.

They were wise to make the 4 player mode half as long as the 2 player mode. I don't think you could get through 80 levels with 4 people without having someone rage quit.

Co-op puzzle games remain an underserved genre, so definitely check this out if you are into that. I'd more generally recommend it to anyone with a living room PC for a unique couch co-op experience.

38122703.review:

It's not as relationship breaking as say co-op mode on 'Splosion Man, but it is close.  

(we skipped the extra challenges though - only eight years together, I think we need more time)

34018186.review: A game about not being able to cooperate with your friends.

33264067.review:
[h1]Diversión al cubo[/h1]

La saga de Portal nos dejó un vacío dificil de llenar, y aún no ha nacido el candidato a hacerlo. Por suerte, la esencia de aquella franquicia supo repartirse entre varios de los fichines que lo sucedieron. Encontrarnos con esos tintes portalescos nos llena el corazón, y es por eso que Death Squared tiene un gustito especial a aquellos tiempos de pruebas fatales, malvadas inteligencias artificiales y robots resolviendo puzzles en forma coordinada mientras intentan sobrevivir.

La propuesta de Death Squared es sencilla, pero efectiva: resolver desafíos mentales que requieren de coordinación e ingenio. Para hacerlo, contamos con unos coloridos robots en forma de cubo a los cuales podemos mover a lo largo de un escenario suspendido en el aire.

Nuestro objetivo es posarnos sobre una marca de nuestro color para finalizar el nivel, pero en el medio nos enfrentamos a baches en el piso, plataformas que se mueven, rayos láser y picos puntiagudos. Los cubos también pueden atravesar los bloques de su mismo color, lo que puede ser una ventaja... o una maldición que nos condene a caer al vacío. Algunos niveles pueden jugarse entre dos jugadores, y otros hasta cuatro, pero todos pueden ser completados por un sólo jugador. 

Pueden leer mi review completa acá:
http://www.irrompibles.net/secciones/reviews/8967-death-squared-review

32380948.review: Great game! I bought it last week and already got to level 60 or so in 2 players coop. It's the kind of game for which I own 4 controllers and feel that there's a use in having real life friends. Also, your friends need not be gamers to get the hang of it. Cool, cool, cool.
32380948.developer_response: Thanks for the review and also for playing with non gamers! We will convert htem one at a time :)

32376671.review:
[h1]10/10 would puzzle again.[/h1] 
There is a lot of things that this game has that I like in a good co-op puzzler.
First 4-player puzzler I've seen in a while.
Has the MPF (Mario Party Effect, aka screaming at your friends while you try to get them to solve it your way.)
Breakdown:

The good
-80 2-player levels
-40 4-player levels
-Secrets (I found my first one in 2-player lvl 30, me & my friend went ALL THE WAY BACK to the START OF THE GAME to try and find more)
-Hilarious Dialogue (lots of refrences, some may say too many refrences)
-Puzzling puzzles, but still short levels. As in, binge-play the whole game at a single party 2-player levels.


The bad:
-no online multiplayer (#1 thing that needs to be added)
-no custom level maker (#2 thing that needs to be added, steam workshop anyone?)
-Cringey refrences (we shall never speak of the ape's name in this household EVER AGAIN)
-Self-destruct mechanic can be a bit too sensitive sometimes

TL:DR: needs online multiplayer, other than that it's a great puzzle game.
32376671.developer_response:
Thanks for review.

Online Multiplayer. We hear you and many others.  Until 2018 we dont have capacity to work on this.
Level Editor: We WISH it was easy to make levels but it isnt. making an editor that isnt a bunch of stuck together pieces is even harder.
And hey "it that shall remain nameless" is still relevant right? :/

32231718.review: Only tried it with two players, but it's a fun co-op game. Very accessible. Real funny, too.

32153259.review:
IMHO, this is one of the best co-op puzzle games on Steam. Very creative design and well thought puzzles, I also like the cute style and BGM. If you love puzzle games in general, you will love this game. And the four players mode put this game above many other puzzle games. A party of four playing this will be fun for any group. The communication, the mess up, the brain storm, the satisfaction after all four work hard in sync to solve the puzzle,  all of the above will make you want to play more. It has all the good elements for a party game.
I am using Xbox Controllers and they work great for me so far. Keyboard control is also fine.

This game is FUN, it is also VERY challenging. The four players levels are no exception. Sometimes when you have dummy friends drop by playing party game, you want something easier. I hope developers come up with easier levels so this game can be played by a wider audience.

32068224.review:
This game has earned itself the top billing on our Party Playlist when I have friends over.

It's like a cross between Twister and those break-the-ice puzzles you do on the first day of a new job.

Each joystick controls one coloured box, which needs to be placed on their respective coloured square.  Sounds easy, but this game is fiendishly difficult - it requires you ALL to stand back and think about it.  Do not rush in 'cos you can almost guarantee your first instinct will always be the wrong one!

This is a game that will uncover the weak-link in your friendships!

I'm looking at you, Paul!!

31844323.review:
Death Squared is an interesting puzzle game that has blocks that are affected by physics.

[b]Disclaimer[/b]
I want to start off by saying that I’ve beaten all single player missions, and have not done any of the multiplayer missions because this game only supports local multiplayer. The reason I’ve decided to not dive into any of the local multiplayer is because many people simply can’t play local multiplayer games as such I’ve decided to look at this game only from a singleplayer perspective.

[b]What's the general gameplay like?[/b]
In this game you will control a red and blue cube that you will move by using the WASD and Arrow Keys, you have to navigate these cubes through levels with several obstacles ranging from deathly lasers to spikes and other moving objects. Then at the end you have to move both cubes onto a circular pad in order to complete the level.

[b]What are some negatives?[/b]
Often you will confuse which cube is moved by which keys on your keyboard, I've often failed a level because I instinctively moved with the wrong set of keys.
The game likes to throw random deaths your way by making spikes appear out of nowhere when you stand on a button, this would be fine if the game wasn't adamant about recording the amount of deaths it takes to beat the level, having cheap one-time deaths defeats that purpose.
Due to the game having physics it's pretty easy to cheese some levels by glitching cubes into places or moving into places that don't feel intended.
I had to play with the SFX Music muted because the cubes would make a horrendous noise when they are placed upon the circular pads (check my video for an example).

[b]What are some positives?[/b]
Background Music is gorgeous and fits really well.
Levels provide some real difficult challenges.
Funny Dialogue between levels.

[b]Closing Thoughts:[/b]
I can't reccomend this game at full price if you are looking for a singleplayer puzzle game, I'd reccomend you wait for it to go on sale.

Want to hear my full thoughts on this title? Check out "My Perspective" on youtube:
https://youtu.be/DE5S8EdqgTY

31639877.review:
It's good in that silly way these kinds of puzzle games are. 

Definitly play it for the co-op.  Communicating with others in order to solve the problems is where I feel most of the fun is had in these types of games.

I feel like perhaps some of the puzzles lack a little polish and the voice acting didn't really do it for me (but that can be turned down or off without impacting gameplay), but other than that, its a scrappy lil game with lots of puzzles to solve, a cute style, and enjoyable gameplay.

31612496.review:
Death Squared is basically the game you break out to test your sanity when communicating with your friends. It makes for a fun, rage-inducing puzzle game whereby a ton of shouting is involved . However, if you like puzzle games on thier own and you have a quieter friend to play with, the 1-2 player mode is a calmer, nicer distraction with added value through the mode-exclusive voice acting. The voice acting here is done by Mick Lauer AKA RIcePirate - an animator and voice actor on Youtube. The voice acting and writing itself isn't Portal level but it is solid. The music in this game is also great. Techno beats add tension to the game and make everythine come alive. This is all wrapped up in plenty of levels which range nicely in difficulty as you start with easy puzzles but move quickly to more and more challenging ones later on. What makes the game so rage inducing in co-op mode is getting everyone on the same page to move to the objective perfectly. Communication is required as some players cannot do everything on thier own. Overall it makes for a fun night.


If you enjoy puzzle games on their own and you also want a nice game to break out to incite hatred (the good kind) among your friends; this is worth the 20$. However, if you already have a stack of co-op local multiplayer games and don't care for the single player puzzle solving aspect; i'd wait for a price drop.

If you want more information I made a video here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dyMSIk4v5_U

31384721.review:
This is a game designed for 2 or 4 players, but can also be played with 1 or 3. In either of these odd combinations, one player will control two of the players.

So far I've only played with 3 players. It's a blast. Some of the puzzles aren't so bad to solve, but actually coordinating as a team can be tricky. I enjoy the challenge of having to control two myself (and they don't usually move at the same time), but that's not for everyone. I'd say most people would likely prefer even numbers of players.

Anyway, this is, for me, the same kind of fun that Magicka is. Sorta slapsticky. This game isn't goofy or intended to have those sorts of things, but with 4 players moving around, people will mess up, or fall off platforms, and people tend to laugh in a mix of amusement and frustration. THIS is the aspect that makes this a great game.

The puzzles are good, but without that mix of amusement and frustration, this game wouldn't be nearly as good.

31366182.review:
Death Squared is a great puzzle Co-Op game to play with almost everyone! It's great fun playing around and exploring the world of death squared and uncovering secrets with my friends. But I wouldn't just reccomend this game to be played with friends. I had the chance to play this at Pax East (2 years in a row) and found the best experiences with this game were with complete strangers! It forces you to communicate with the other players and learn to cooperate with whoever you're playing with.

Another suprising aspect of this game is the story behind it. Anyone could get away with making a 2 or 4 player Co-Op game like this with absolutely no story, and nobody would complain. SMG Studio decided to go the extra mile and add dialogue in between the levels giving the game a plot!

Overall, I'd rate the game 9/10. The downsides being the lack of accessibility to the customization and my good friend Mr.ThirdWheel will have to cycle in our 2 player campaign every few levels.

31347987.review:
I was looking for an engaging couch coop puzzle game and this is it! We had a good laugh when the lasers moved in unexpected ways and surprised us; we had to really think hard about some of the levels and the cooperation needed to move forward was a really fun exercise for us. We made it intense by pushing hard to solve each level and it proved to be a lot of solid fun. The game is relatively simple and I have not encountered any bugs. I am on level 70 so far with the two person version.

I recommend that the developers implement a hint system which appears after a certain amount of struggle in moving to the next level. Overall highly recommended.

31275057.review:
This is a fantastic and unique coop puzzle game! There are well over 100 levels between the 2- and 4-player modes, many of which are pretty devious. The 2-player mode can be done solo with one controller if that's your thing. The 4-player mode probably could too although it might get pretty hard. It took me roughly 11 hours to complete all the levels (5 hours were played at my buddy's house on his account), which is a great value.

It also doesn't require any sort of experience playing video games, so it would be a great game to play with friends or family who doesn't normally play video games.

31271380.review:
You know those games you play with mates where you spend the whole time yelling at each other or laughing or cheering? This game is one of those. The puzzles are great - there's a hell good balance of like silly fun and actual brain challenging moments, and it's just like heaps crisp and easy to get into.

Full good party game.

31216253.review:
Problems with the joystyc control.
I want to play this game in local multiplayer mode, 4 players.
I use generic control, I tried using x360ce but the game does not accept.
I'm looking for help.
I am very dissatisfied!

30783208.review:
I definitely recommend this game, whether you plan to play it yourself, or with friends. I play mainly by myself at home, and it is entirely possible to play all of the puzzles using one controller. I have not tried playing using a keyboard, but I would not be surprised if there was some way to make that work as well.

This game is also a blast to play with friends, I have done so when I played a beta version of the game at PAX East last year. It requires a lot of cooperation between players and discussion about how to fix problems when you fail a level together. Just be careful about who you play with. If you have a partner who doesn't know what they're doing, it could lead to some arguments. I'm pretty sure the couple who played this before myself and my friend at PAX must've broken up with each other afterwards, they had some pretty heated arguments when one of the messed up.

Enough stories though. Buy this game, it's a ton of fun, there are plenty of levels to play, and they're just tough enough to make you have to think about what to do while not being so insanely hard that you just want to give up. The one thing I wish this game had was online co-op, since it's hard to get friends over to my house, but I can see how it would be much tougher to play with someone without having them being right next to you. The devs did a fantastic job with this

30679868.review:
这可能是我这辈子玩过最奇葩的合作游戏了，单身狗专用合作解密游戏，左手与右手之间的无缝配合，只能说太好玩了...
优点：

+个别关卡可以一个人操作四个人物，可谓自己与自己与自己与自己四人合作游戏的巅峰；
缺点：

-玩了以后感觉什么队友都是辣鸡，自己和自己玩才是合作类游戏的精髓；
-好像会暴露什么；

30668488.review: Played this in Beta, Really amazing Co-Op Experience along with Single Player. Haven't quite played a game that crosses the boundaries so well.

30626409.review: Great game and fun puzzles. But needs more indication, (when playing less than 4 controllers in party mode,) which sticks on what controllers, are controlling each colour.

30537080.review:
4인 게임 찾고 있었는데 이 게임이 있더라구요. 근데 출시된지 얼마 안돼서 평가 2명에 리뷰도 없고 해서 제가 사봤습니다.
결론적으론 최고입니다. 접대용으로도 이만한게 없구요, 4인 패드 2개만 있어도 됩니다. 패드 한 개에 아날로그 스틱 두개가 각각 할당이라 두 대에 있는 아날로그 스틱 4개로 모두 조종 가능합니다.
스토리 모드일 때도 패드 두 개를 꼽으면 각각 하나씩 이지만 패드를 한 개만 꼽으면 아날로그 하나당 정육면체 한 개가 할당됩니다. 또한 키보드의 wasd와 방향키도 각각 할당이기 때문에 사실상 키보드만 있어도 둘이서 스토리모드 가능하고 한 명 키보드+한 명 패드 조합도 가능합니다. 단, 4인 모드의 경우는 키보드에 할당된 1p, 2p= 1p 패드의 아날로그 스틱 두 개 이기 때문에 패드는 최소 두 개가 있어야 4p가 가능합니다.
또한 요즘 울트라 와이드 21:9 쓰시는 분 많은데 이 게임이 처음 켜면 이 해상도로 켜집니다. 그런데 그래픽 설정 건드리다 어플라이를 눌러버리면 돌이킬 수가 없어요. 선택지에는 1920x1080이 끝이거든요. 별 짓을 다해도 레지스트리가 남아있어서 돌이킬 수 없습니다.

21:9 화면 복원시키는 법

1. 레보 언인스톨러 등 레지스트리까지 찾아서 모두 삭제해주는 프로그램으로 싹 민 다음 새로 설치한다.
단점: 세이브 데이터 같이 삭제
2. 시작메뉴에서 regedt 치고 실행
레지스트리 편집기가 열리면 HKEY_CURRENT_USER -> Software -> SMG studio -> Death Squared
로 들어갑니다.
그러면 레지스트리 파일 중 Screenmanager Resolution~ 파일이 두 개 있는데 더블클릭해서 데이터값을 수정해줍니다.
fhd 21:9의 경우 2560x1080이니 Width만 눌러서 10진법에 체크 해주고 2560을 써줍니다. 다시 16진법 누르고 저장하면 알아서 수정되고 데이터 보면 (2560)이라고 나옵니다. 패치 되겠지만 그 전에 해상도로 스트레스 받으실 분들 참고하세요.

결론: 간단한 퍼즐 좋아하고 친구가 많거나 손님이 잦다면 갓겜이다.

30523605.review:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=883992465

Death Squared é um jogo cooperativo de puzzle muito original, que apesar de possuir uma jogabilidade extremamente simples, tem como verdadeira riqueza o fato do movimento de cada jogador afetar direta e proporcionalmente objetos das fases. Dessa forma, cabe ao jogador identificar esses padrões, para saber os movimentos a serem feitos.

Portanto, é um jogo primariamente de puzzle, que apesar de exigir precisão nos movimentos, não exige reflexos ou algo do gênero. Tudo calmo! Os desafios são cada vez maiores, com cada vez mais objetos e padrões de interação, e são um prato cheio pra quem curte enigmas.

A cooperação é apenas local, para 2 jogadores no modo Story e 4 jogadores no modo Party.

30518153.review:
A game designed by sadists made for masochists...

Actually though, it's a phenomenal co-op experience that will both frustrate and delight whoever you trick into playing it with you. It even has some reasonably-clever dialogue for no apparent reason. Worth the purchase price simply to support this kind of game.

10/10 would explode again

30512864.review:
Very fun game to play with your intelligent friends. A lot of cooperation by talking, pointing and shouting at each other which makes the whole social aspect of this very satisfying! ;)

Thus far I've played 4 player Party mode with 40 levels, and I know there is 80 other levels in the story mode with voice acting too. The learning curve is good with a increasing difficulity. I have not made it to the last levels yet, but already halfway it got so tricky/clever that some rounds took some time to complete! :P

30505313.review:
Death Squared is a surprisingly clean and competent puzzle game. It can be played solo or cooperatively with both methods of play working smoothly and satisfyingly. It stands well above the average when it comes to indie puzzle games and features a big chunk of content, challenging but not unfair difficulty, and even a surprisngly well voice-acted narration that injects humour and personality into the game.

The aim of the game is to coordinate and move both cubes safely to the end, but obstacles and tricky environments can make that a challenging task.

The game offers:

80 x 'story levels' (can be played solo or local coop)
40 x 'party levels' (intended for 2 to 4 players - but all content is possible solo, if you can coordinate)
10 x '2-player experiments'
10 x '4-player experiments'

Death Squared controls well, I plugged in a controller and controlled one cube using the left joystick and one with the right joystick. You could alternatively use 'wasd' and 'arrow keys' to control the cubes. I also played coop where I used the controller and my partner the keyboard, although you could share a keyboard if you like, every method works.

The puzzles are also satisfying, not so difficult they made me rage but definitely challenging. Death Squared tested the player not just in their wit and puzzle solving abilities, but also in their coordination, cooperation (if played with a partner) and memory. I will say that the puzzles will often be solved using trial-and-error which isn't inheriently a bad thing, but was sometimes less satisfying because of it.

The game also had a tonne of personality (think Portal) which helped to seperate it from its sometimes more clinical competition. One of the few criticisms I had of the game was the inability to access the options menu from the pause screen, needing to instead back out to the main menu. The options also didn't include subtitles which I would have liked to ensure I didn't mishear any of the dialogue, although there are potentially hearing impaired players out there who this will be an even bigger issue for - I'm hoping they patch that in.

Ulimately a fun experience though. If you like puzzle games you will like Death Squared. Coop always makes things more fun and only adds to this experience. It's the perfect entry game for a friend, partner, or family member who isn't usually into gaming to jump in with you.

* For a more detailed review visit http://checkpointgaming.net/reviews/2017/03/death-squared/

30502023.review: Funny puzzle game that anyone can pick up and play. I played this with my parents on the weekend and they rarely play video games.
